children.text: There are roof tiles that have been dislodged/not sitting flat, which looks poorly finished.
The Victorian Building Authority’s, Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 6.08 Undulating tiled roof lines states that
‘Undulations in the line of roof tiles are defective if the variation exceeds 20mm in any 4m length measured in the roof plane’ .
Additionally, clause 6.01 Leaks in roofing, flashings and accessories states that

‘Roofing, including flashings and accessories, is defective if it leaks under normal weather conditions and is due to the builder’s workmanship, causes unhealthy or dangerous conditions, loss of amenity for occupants, undue dampness or deterioration of building elements’ .
The roof tiling should be fully checked and rectified in accordance with above to prevent any leaks.
